questions.text: Which of these were not part of the modern three tenors?
questions.explanation:
Caruso.

	Caruso was a legendary tenor of the early 20th century. The other three make up the modern 'three tenors'.

questions.text: Kaspar, Melchior and Balthasar are better known as the three what?
Which of the following is not one of the three Japanese alphabets?
questions.explanation:
Hatagana.

	Kanji is based on Chinese writing, Hirogana and Katakana are both made up of phonetic characters.

questions.text: Can you name any one of the three great masters of Greek tragedy?
Euryale, Medusa and Stheno are collectively known as the three what?
